10835924.review:
Sobre
Rune retrata muito bem a mitologia nórdica e leva o jogador a locais inimagináveis, cenários de sonho e a aventuras de cortar a respiração. Transportando o jogador a idade medieval, onde os Vikings eram os conquistadores, Rune combina na perfeição o combate corpo a corpo e exploração com uma história fantástica, recriando na perfeição um período da história caracterizado pela conquista do poder. Com efeitos especiais de grande qualidade e um balanço perfeito entre armas e guerreiros, possibilidade de jogo em modo jogador único, Multijogador, Deathmatch entre outros, 15 armas variadas desde martelos a toda a variedade de espadas, inimigos diversos, evoluído sistema de combate corpo a corpo onde o jogador pode aproveitar as armas de seus inimigos, inventário simples e muito dinâmico. 

Introdução
Prepare-se, de agora em diante seu nome é Ragnar, um jovem viking e majestoso guerreiro de uma era distante. Numa terra onde a justiça fala pela espada. Com uma perigosa missão. Loki, a ovelha negras dos Deuses, estava abusando de seus poderes em todos os nove mundos, até que um dia ele chegou longe de mais fazendo com que Hodr, o filho cego de Odin matasse seu próprio irmão Balder com uma flecha feita de um ramo de visco, que por sua vez fora enganado por Loki. Odin, o maior dos deuses juntamente com seu filho Thor, deus do trovão, decidiram prende-lo com correntes a centenas de quilômetros abaixo da superfície da terra, e ao redor dele foi colocada uma cobra gigantesca com um veneno ácido extremamente mortal, a tortura é imensa, o veneno corria pelo corpo de Loki corroendo seus órgãos até chegar à coluna vertebral, mas devido ser um deus, ele também é imortal, e seus poderes agiam de forma a curar lentamente os estragos feitos pelo veneno da cobra. A cobra era infalível, como também eram os poderes de cura de Loki. A agonia era imensa e interminável. Devido Thor ter acorrentado Loki, Odin proclamou que Loki permaneceria lá, com a imensa dor do veneno da cobra até o dia que em que o Ragnarök chegasse e começasse a maior de todas as batalhas já feitas, envolvendo deuses, (Aesires e Vanires, liderado por Odin), os Jotuns (gigantes de fogo, entre outros monstros, liderados por Loki), homens e todos os seres vivos, mudando o destino de tudo que virá a existir, e só então Loki seria libertado. Naquela batalha entre deuses e monstros, foi assumido que Loki teria uma missão que lhe foi imposta, mas Loki era a ovelha negra lembram? Bom, Loki mudou um pouco os planos... Bom agora cabe há você de impedir as forças sombrias de Loki e adiantar o temível ragnarök que levará ao fim do Mundo. 

Jogabilidade
No estilo (ação em 3ª pessoa, com a mesma visão de Tommy Vercetti no consagrado Grand Theft Auto: Vice City, mas com inúmeras qualidades a mais, começando pelo número de armas e acessórios, o jogador terá o controle de uma simples espada a poderosos machados e martelos gigantes, cada qual com sua característica, sendo que com certa espada, por exemplo, será mais fácil de matar certo tipo de inimigo e assim sucessivamente com todas as outras armas. Também há a possibilidade "encantar" sua arma com Runas, que estão espalhados por todas as fases do jogo, ou seja, quando estiver muito pressionado, com um grande número de inimigos, e se estiver com barra de Runas com certa quantia cheia, é só usar, deixando sua espada cheia de fogo tornando muito mais mortífera ou pegando um super machado que estraçalha seus inimigos com apenas um ataque, além de muitos outros poderes, pois cada arma possui um poder diferente. Outro sistema muito bem feito é o Berserk, pois seu personagem entra em estado de frenesi, nesse estado é possível deixar em pedaços seus inimigos com apenas um ataque, você pode entrar em Frenesi por duas formas, usando uma runa ou cortando as cabeças de seus inimigos, aos dissépalos irá aumentar uma barra de "raiva", pois quando essa barra chegar ao máximo você entra em Frenesi, seus olhos ficam vermelhos, sua respiração fica acelerada, e sua voz muda, seus ataques mais ferozes. Os detalhes da jogabilidade são incríveis, muito bem estudados, como as partes onde o personagem precisa subir por cordas ou cipós, fazendo os movimentos perfeitos do corpo, ou quando ele precisa pular sobre elásticos para subir em lugares mais altos, fazendo dele um jogo sem igual. Mas não pense que é só ir matando tudo o que passa pela frente, por que apenas isso não adiantará, muitas fases requerem um grande raciocínio do jogador para seguir adiante, um exemplo é o labirinto de Loki, onde uma vez que você errar o caminho você volta ao inicio, as lendárias construções dos anões onde haverá muitos desafios e sem falar nas inúmeras cavernas aquáticas cheias de túneis e um mortífero Leviatã te perseguindo, esses são apenas um dos problemas que o jogador encontrará. 

Gráficos
Rune conseguiu consagrar sua época em que foi lançado, e mostrou que a engine do Unreal Tournament é uma das melhores já criadas, mas tudo muito mesmo esta realista, desde o jeito de mover-se, atacar e usar Runas, Rune suporta altas resoluções desde que sua placa tenha essas opções API's, Direct 3D, Glide, OpenGL, MeTal, e como se não fosse o bastante ele não fica carregado de mais rodando em altas resoluções e com tudo ativado. Os personagens estão bem trabalhados como podem ver nas screenshots, dando um ótimo realismo ao jogo. Mas infelizmente ao mudar a visão do jogador para a 1º pessoa você percebe que os detalhes gráficos de seus inimigos não estão tão bons assim, comparado aos jogos da atualidade. Suas armas também ganharam cuidados especiais, parecendo reais, como por exemplo, apos uma sangrenta batalha sua roupa e armas ficarão completamente banhadas de sangue, mas se você é daquele tipo de pessoa que não suporta ver sangue não se preocupe, pois e só você ir ao rio mais próximo e se molhar, pois o sangue de sua roupa e suas armas irmão embora junto com a correnteza. Você ainda pode "brincar" com os pedaços do corpo de seus inimigos, como uma perna, braço ou ate mesmo a cabeça deles, você pode arremessar ou usar como arma. Outra coisa muito interessante é o modo em que você mata seus inimigos, pois alguns só morrem se você dissépalos, outros somente se você cortar suas garras, e claro, ao lutar contra algum inimigo do tipo humano, há uma chance de você arranca o braço dele fora, fazendo-o fugir de você e espalhando sangue por toda parte.

Áudio
A parte de áudio esta excelente, principalmente quando o Ragnar esta em combate, ele rosna como se estivesse muito furioso e gastando energia nos golpes. Ouvir o som dos escudos se quebrando, o brandir das espadas e os gritos de sofrimento e dor que seus inimigos fazem ao serem mortos só contribui ainda mais para o envolvimento do jogador ao fantástico mundo viking. As músicas também estão muito boas, dando ainda mais emoção e empolgação ao jogador. As vozes dos dubladores estão impecáveis principalmente a sombria voz de Loki e sua risada extremamente maligna. 

MultiPlayer
O Multiplayer dele é muito bom, mas se jogado por várias pessoas, o motivo é que no Rune as armas não são de tiro, e ai os combates se limitam mais no corpo a corpo, ou seja, pancadaria um na frente do outro, até tem opção de jogar as armas, mas nada como uma sniper. 

Conclusão
Rune é um dos melhores jogos que eu já joguei, de repente não para quem é fanático por multiplayer, mas para quem gosta de single player e de cumprir os objetivos do jogo até o final, vai vidrar no Rune, pois o jogo é muito extenso e garante horas e horas de muita ação e adrenalina, a parte gráfica mesmo é inacreditável, até melhor que alguns jogos da atualidade, pois rune foi feito em 2000 e este release (Rune Classic) só aperfeiçoou o jogo.
 Concluindo, RUNE e daqueles jogos que não saem da cabeça, jogue e fique viciado!

10725167.review:
So after playing this for a couple days I think this game deserves some attention. And I used to play this a long time ago in 2002 at it's time this game was considered "advanced" it's basically 2001's version of Skyrim (the only problem is there is no free roam,) but now things these days look close to real life I highly doubt this will compete with the other games you might consider getting. Now before I get into detail no not the kind of attention Halo: CE and Half Life get, this game is fun but that's about it there isn't a HUGE deep story behind this game so don't expect something like Halo or Half Life just expect the typical 1990 "kill everything in your path" kind of game. 

Story/plot: The story begins with an introduction saying Odin the all father gave humanity great powerful lucky charms--*Ahem!* I mean rune stones to hold Ragnarock at bay. However the evil god Loki has attempted many times to unleash Ragnarock by destroying these runes. 

So instead of constantly fighting him every generation Odin had enough of his bullshit so he ended up tearing Loki's heart out and banished him into a dungeon like hell. But even with his magic power stripped away and imprisoned he managed to corrupt a handful of mortals to join his wicked demonic army. This then leads to a showdown between the corrupt and evil vikings, and a village's chief and son Ragnar (you the player are Ragnar) so the village's best warriors were all slaughtered in merely seconds by magic bolts of lightning summoned by Loki's herald (I know I'm writing a review but there are no characters in this game besides Loki Ragnar and Odin so I can't remember his name currently) everyone dies including Ragnar's father. 

However Odin revives Ragnar and says that he is giving Ragnar a chance at revenge if he can save the rune stones and stop Loki's return. Ragnar of course without a moment of thought accepts the offer and fights his way through monsters, demons, undead, to hell and back all the way into the mountains fighting vikings, dwarves, giants, and the list goes on! you eventually become a war lord through your journey and now you must travel to Loki's dungeon and finish the fight the gods started. 

I won't spoil the rest but there is a lot to fight in this game which makes me disappointed that at the time we didn't have the proper technology to make a free roaming game. Because this universe has tons of potential! this is REAL norse mythology! not like Skyrim where everyone worships made up half naked bikini models that enjoy watching people bang. I would love to see more of this but in a free roaming world or at least an anniversary edition with new graphics and textures along with a lot of polishing. 

This game may end on the very first installment but it deserves a modern RPG sequel (or prequel) anything can be done in this universe the IP is there we just need a new developer building or re-building this universe.

Multiplayer: it's fun but very competitive, there is no "help me" or "power upgrades" or tanks, there is nothing to give you an edge over everyone else in the match. It's classic skill vs skill who is the better man? (or woman) basically multiplayer is thunder dome "two men enter, one man leaves...And respawns again to get his ass kicked" so it's fun but it's not the best multiplayer I've seen in early 2000 games. The other question you might ask is: "is there customization?" yes, and a bit of no, there are skins/playermodels (however you want to call it) you can change into but there is no armor customization you can unlock and dress up in, or mix and match pieces of sets. (I think there are skin mods but I'm not too sure they're safe to download) but if you want to mod in your own skin I support the idea 100% the game could use a fix here and there.

Final verdict: I'm giving the game a 7/10 now if this was 2004 or something I would have given it an 8 but this game is extremely outdated and old. So, does it belong in your library? yes and no, it depends what your computer can run. And there are better games out there that you can spend 10$ or less on. It's still a great game though, believe me I still love this game to this very day! but it's not a perfect game, as far as modern preferences go. I would love to see more, a complete free roaming RPG could be adapted into this universe giving a new fresh nordic IP, hell if it has Co-op mode, free roaming, and competitive multiplayer, it might even beat Skyrim! but until then we have to wait and see.

10009250.review:
Hot diggity dog. Nothing slaps some hair on your chest like a good ole viking themed game.
Fricking [b]Rune[/b] dude is pretty awesome
I haven't beaten the game though I have put more than half a day into it so I feel obligated to review.
Also I'm trying to get used to typing on my new keyboard.
It doesn't shake my desk as much as my old one used to.
Anway what should I get started on?
Graphics. I'm not a graphics whore. The game originally came out in between '99-'02, feel free to correct me if I am wrong. And this "classic" re-release like idk within the decade. I haven't seen what the original looks like but the update is apparently better so let's just say that. Character's faces are emotionless and have robotic jaws but whatevs, it holds up well enough. There are way worse looking indie games that came out last yesterday. Textures are sharp enough. Whatever that means. Lighting is pretty nice, FOR SUCH A DARK GAME. Seriously, I felt like I was playing Doom 3 when marching through Hel. Levels are lengthy, and vary in look and theme. So far, I've pillaged through a village in Midgar, the depths of an aquatic underworld, Hel, herself's realm, and are conquering a snowy fortress right now.
Story, from what I can tell so far, is simple, yet not bad. You play as young, 'roided up, unbearded, lad, named Ragnar, who is given the honor of being a guardian of one of the Runes that Odin placed around Midgar. Some dude, Conrack, I think his name was, wants to harness the power of the Runes to unleash Loki, and initate Ragnarok. Conrack then, kills Ragnar and his family and friends, battle buddies, thanes, whatever. Odin brings Ragnar back to life, for him to seek revenge and tadaaa. Kill stuff.
Gameplay consists of drinking mead, beating guys to death with their friends' dismembered arms, dying, getting frustrated at your computer, and the occasional platforming segment. Combat feels like an Elder Scrolls game's melee combat in 3rd person. Minus killcams and leveling up. Left click hurts things, right click keeps things from hurting you. Enemies react appropiately to where they are hit, most of the time, such as being able to decapitate enemies with one lucky slice or destroying their shields when you happen to hit it while the shield isn't drawn. You have 3 weapon categories, sword, axe, and mace, and each weapon comes with their own rune power, such as an axe that can life-steal or sword that can harness the power of Grayskull. You might also die a lot. It's the Dark Souls of yesteryear.
Now onto the audio aspect of the game. From what I've noticed, there is hardly any music but when there is, its not too terrible. Same goes for voice acting. Enemies and Ragnar make crunchy noises and scream when harmed that are higher quality than Two Worlds II.
In a nutshell, while the combat is no God Of War Ascension, graphics are not Battlefield 63, and music isn't produced by Amon Amarth, you should still buy this game if you're interested in it. Don't even wait until its on sale. Grow yourself a beard, kick down a door, drink some mead, and buy this game. There basically no viking games and this one is a lot of damn fun, so why not.

9768147.review:
As I kick off my slightly longer, more detailed reviews on some of my Steam games, it's only appropriate that I start with a game that was part of my youth. 

Rune is, surprisingly enough, one of the few games focusing on Norse mythology that made it into history. Not many good and consistent ones out there, and this one brings its own identity in terms of gameplay, aesthetics, and character development. It creates its own accounting of Norse cultural and religious topoi in fiction, and that does more good than harm as far as the storyline progression is concerned. You play as Ragnar, a young man whose responsibilities escalate with the killing of his kinsfolk and the dooming of his birthplace, Wotankeld. Simple name for a protagonist, simple purpose for his endeavour. Vengeance couldn't be bitterer and more predictable.

But that's where things get sharp in Rune. You're introduced to fluent combat mechanics, advanced graphics for the time (the first Unreal Engine was just starting its brilliant run), and the grandeur of the game's environmental variety. This is a videogame epic tale, with all its classic characteristics, as the protagonist rises through the image of the savior and avenger of his clan and descends into the dark realms of Helgrind, imprisoned, assuming the figure of bare life and shamanistic sacrifice - true to the Norse notion of the Cosmogonic death in order to attain the knowledge of the Runes; Wotan speared onto Yggdrasil -, to then rise again as the ultimate Berserkr who transcends revenge and defies material existence. Ragnar is ready to put it on the line at every moment. And that motif is auxiliary to the development of the game's combat system, a hack-n'-slash which is as smooth as it gets, and a map configuration that challenges the player's reasoning as well as it puts them under the pressure of claustrophobia and constant darkness.

This is an atmospheric game, and a grim one as it is. The double ending is up to you, and that's a bonus coming from an action game with tacit storytelling elements. Rune scores high in both single-player and multiplayer - which is still active, and resembles heavily the fun and flow of the Unreal deathmatches -, and the variety of weapons, as well as the distinct styles and contrast in movement swiftness that each one of them brings up, enrich the game even further.

A must-have for hack-n'-slash fans, as well as fans of games that dialogue with the epic genre.

9272460.review:
I just finished the single player mode after a little bit over 10 hours of gameplay and what can I say?

This is the remake of a very solid  hack and slay games from the early 2000s, the graphics haven't improved much (or at least that's why my spoiled eyes see nowadays) but it doesn't lessen the fun, while hacking and jumping through hordes of monsters. 

Admittedly there's not that much variety amongst the monsters and the scenes, there a few major themes, but well ... in the end they all boil down to a rather straightforward and linear design (pull a lever here, press a plate there, kill some more monsters etc.). It was still fun. Nearing the end I was wondering if it'd be better if some of the scenes would have been shorter ...

But I guess we owe this to the age of the original game, back then I had much more time to spent, today I like to be able to finish a game while it is still hot ;-)

Speaking of hot, the game provides you with a little story, which is told in various ingame cutscenes (skippable with the ctrl key). It's nothing to fancy, but it was enough keep me entertained till the end non the less, mainly with its interesting background (I used steam overlay to lookup references to the nordic mythology from time to time, very interesting and it made me appreciate the game even more). Another thing I have to mention, is that this remake is well done from a technical standpoint, I played this with a resolution of 1920x1080 on my Windows 7 64bit machine and I haven't had a single crash or glitch*, the controls are very smooth and intuitive.

All in all I can recommend getting this game if:
a) you like hacking stuff
b) you like vikings
c) you played 3d computer games in the 90s and early 2000 and don't care to much how the game looks (it's an unreal engine game)

When it was on sale you were able to get it for 2,50€ which is absolutely fair for the 10 hours of sp fun it provides (not counting the multiplayer - if you like multiplayer games like Half-Life Deathmatch, with vikings)

* (well, actually there is a problem in one of the last levels, where a triggered cutscene causes the game to freeze, if you disable sound for that mission then you're fine. If you've reached this point however, you're so determined to finish that game, that this minor hickup probably wont bother you anymore ;-) )

I'd never played this when it came out (and I even only vaguely remember it being released) so I came to this objectively and without expectation - What a surprise! For the time, I think the game is fairly accessible, and the combat is also quite strong. Other third person games from the time haven't aged well and have combat systems to boot, but not here.

The graphics are running off the Unreal Engine. I can't precisely pinpoint what version it is but by the looks of things it's the original Unreal Tournament and it looks surprisingly good for it's age. What it lacks in graphical fidelity, it makes up for in beautiful level design and great lighting. A lot of reviews here say to ignore the graphics but I think they're quite good.

I think it's important to mention that the game seems to have been optimized for this release for modern rigs. I managed to run it at 1920x1080 and I didn't have to do any kind of behind-the-scenes tomfoolery to get a decent widescreen resoluton working - it all just worked right out of the options menu. Good stuff. If only more old games could be ported to steam like this!

8176316.review:
Para mí, Rune es el icono por excelencia del género Hack and Slash, un juegazo de acción incluso más divertido que algunos de los títulos actuales de este género. 

La libertad de acción en Rune es algo impresionante para sus 14 años de antiguedad: Los controles son de lo más fluido que he visto en ningún videojuego de su época;  multitud de combos, movimientos evasivos, cámara controlada por ratón, puedes lanzar cualquier arma... incluso puedes dar de hostias a los enemigos cogiendo las cabezas, brazos y otros miembros del cuerpo que les hayas arrancado en la pelea.

El arsenal es de lo más completo que podrás ver, cuentas con espadas, hachas, mazas... cada arma con su poder propio que puedes invocar siempre y cuando tengas suficiente energía. 

La campaña te llevará unas 20 horas completarla, la historia es simple pero entretenida. No tiene desperdicio.

Los entornos son muy detallados, puedes hacer añicos casi cualquier cosa que te encuentres por el camino, las armas con filo se clavan si las arrojas a la madera, hay puzzles de todo tipo y cantidad de alimentos que consumir para curar las heridas sufridas durante la matanza; carne asada, aguamiel, fruta, lagartijas...

Y lo mejor de todo es el multijugador. Imáginate un Chivalry con el motor gráfico de Unreal Tournament, la diversión está garantizada.

En resumen: en Rune encarnas a un vikingo armado hasta los dientes que va en busca de Loki, mientras se cura las heridas de guerra zampándose todo lo que pilla por delante.

[list]
[*]Gráficos: [b]8,5/10[/b]
[*]Sonido: [b]7/10[/b]
[*]Duración: [b]8/10[/b]
[*]Historia: [b]7,5/10[/b]
[*]Jugabilidad: [b]9/10[/b]
[/list]

[h1][u]Nota final[/u][/h1]

[b]8,5/10[/b]

862863.review:
I'll start off by summarizing whether or not I think you should buy Rune Classic:
Absolutely. Rune is an excellent game and a good time for anyone who enjoys vikings, chopping things up, and fighting vikings with other chopped up vikings. Definitely something that deserves people's support.

However, I cannot stress this enough: I highly recommend getting the original over this version.

The added enemy types, while a welcome thing to see, are superfluous and poorly thought out. More often than not, creatures that ostensibly should be on the same side fought themselves before even giving me so much as a glance. In trying to hit me, they hit eachother, which would anger the other enemy and make it attack.

It all depends on whether or not this has been patched since my playthrough.

Additionally, Rune Classic cuts and modifies many maps from the singleplayer campaign, even to the point that a major plot point is completely omitted. Granted, in the grand scheme of the game this is inconsequential because you're probably just here for viking-themed hack-and-slash fun, but it annoys me to no end. At least the original files are still there, which is more than you can say for most remakes that give a game that kind of treatment, but it still seems odd to me that so much was cut out when most of the changes seem to be centered around online multiplayer.

On that note, I am also still not a big fan of the moving around of the rune skills, something I feel was done solely with Multiplayer in mind. The special abilities of each weapon were different in the original. The handaxe is too strong, the roman sword is no longer the perfect zombie-slaying weapon you can find in the underworld... But I honestly can't tell if this gripe is pure nostalgia for the way it was, or if it is a genuine detriment to the game's design.

There were also a slew of new bugs and glitches that were not present when I later tried out the original release, on the same machine no less! Objects spawned incorrectly, the man-o-wars that are supposed to come down from the waterfalls would get stuck, plants in particular appear upside-down until you brush into them and jiggle them into their upright position. I also have strange issues with stereo sound where the volume levels seem to be completely backwards.
Very glaringly obvious issues, yet not everyone seems to have them... So I can only assume that, in modifying the game and (probably) making it run better on modern PC's, they also made it much less stable on specific setups.

All in all, this remake seems to have had the most care put into the online component, which arguably was Rune's strongest point in the first place. If that's what you're here for, Rune Classic is the game for you. But if you like a strong singleplayer campaign, stick with the original.

 Of this genre I have found no games that surpass this one in deliciousness. The combat is chancy at times, but if you pay attention to its mechanics you can start using each detail to your advantage.

This was the best game ever made with the old Unreal Engine (you know, the first one). Unlike all the shooters, this is purely a melee game. You hack away with swords, axes and hammers, there is a beserker rage and also a little buffing magic in the form of pick-up runestones. Healing yourself is possible by eating whatever edibles you come across, or using the occasional healing rune. The story takes you across caverns, snowy mountain ranges, the realm of the Nibelung dwarves and even through Hel, the fiery underworld.
The game has pre-shader graphics, so expect no miracles, but the setting and artwork are in my opinion good enough to revisit despite aged graphics. Multiplayer is basic and not really well-balanced, but fun enough if not taken too seriously. Did I mention that you can chop off limbs in this game? This includes heads, and yes, some enemies only die if you remove their heads.
I daresay this is a must-have for all once and future friends of Norse sagas.
Hail Odin!

39566246.review:
Juego de acción y aventura de culto de principios de los 2000 de temática vikinga. Un estilo ya muy de la vieja escuela, con puzles, exploración, plataformeo y tortas. Muy oscuro, algo putero en su dificultad y con un combate con más chicha de lo que parece. Guarda un feel similar a Dark Souls, aunque son juegos muy diferentes.  

Esta versión Classic funciona con sistemas actuales con más o menos soltura. Tiene algunos glitches, pero nada grave. 
Más que recomendable para jugar a día de hoy, aunque sea sólo por mera curiosidad histórica. Atentos a la secuela que prepara el estudio para dentro de unos años.

39764220.review:
rune这个游戏应该是发售于2000年，属于动作冒险类游戏。采用的是虚幻一代引擎制作的。它展现了维京神话中那种血与火的交织的观念，是一个非常男人的游戏，换言之，对于有的人来说，它可能太过于暴力。不过本人非常喜欢这个游戏，早在2000年第一次接触这个游戏的时候，就被震撼住了，这种震撼主要是来自于游戏所营造出的气氛，这个气氛之中包含了画面、游戏的系统、打击感与音乐、音效，还有彪悍的主题，因为这个游戏，它奠定了我对游戏的某些看法，以至于一直影响到此后很多年我对游戏的判断。

虽然说属于动作冒险类游戏，但其实他本质上更偏向act游戏。最近有听说rune要出续作，续作的名称叫“rune:ragnarok”<北欧神话:诸神之黄昏>,非常的关注。毕竟时隔18年之久了，据说游戏改成沙盒类了，这个改动是好的，但希望不要失去rune那种血火交融的血统。当年pc就玩这个游戏rune，后来为了shinobi超级忍入了ps2，为了忍龙入了Xbox。rune在个人心目当中是同级别的act神作，现在听说要出测试版，非常的期待。就是不清楚rune ragnarok 测试版的具体推出时间。

时隔多年再来玩这个游戏，发现游戏与当初比较有些调整与变动，比如：删去了一些关卡，其中有删得好的，比如海底出来后欺负螃蟹的某些关卡，但是雪山城堡有一关非常的经典，是雪山城堡最有特色与典型代表的一关，就是释放出一些牢笼中的黑维京与白维京厮斗的那关，这是一个改动的失策。武器上有一些改动与调整，原本维京腰刀的符文是吸血攻击的，改为了维京短剑吸血攻击，原本维京短剑的魔法盾改为了维京斧魔法盾，维京腰刀改为了友好术。另外，游戏加入了一些新的怪物与巨人，这一点不错的，尽管攻击方式上其实没有变化。但这款游戏还是属于一款硬派核心向的游戏，在这个时代改变是需要的，但不要失去自己的方向，衷心的希望rune的续作能够顺利重启，并取得巨大的成功。
